TextSection.Contents: Distal trisomy 9q is a rare chromosomal anomaly resulting from the partial trisomy of the long arm of chromosome 9 with a variable phenotype mostly characterized by psychomotor and speech delay intellectual disability hypotonia long narrow habitus craniofacial dysmorphism (incl. micro/dolichocephaly facial asymmetry narrow palpebral fissures deep-set eyes strabismus microphthalmia abnormally shaped ears microstomia micro/retrognathia) and hand and feet anomalies (incl. arachnodactyly camptodactyly abnormal implantation of digits). Congenital flexion contractures and limited joint movements have also been observed.

Parent.Label: Partial duplication of the long arm of chromosome 9 syndrome
